page.title: 03EVINGTON BROOK
page.content: We first see this stream as it leaves a drainage ditch near Judgemeadow Secondary School. It then runs south east towards the Leicestershire Golf Course. Part of its course forms the boundary between Evington and the district of Harborough. The stream is small and has a bed made up of sand and gravel. It is also quite shallow. It contains sticklebacks, and many minnows, water shrimps and stone leaches. There are a number of bridges over the stream. Golfers use them, but also people walking through the Golf Course, as there is a footpath running by the side of the stream. Walkers exercise their dogs or are just taking fresh air. The stream is an obvious hazard to golfers. At places the bank is boarded, but a number of trees have fallen across as the water erodes the soil from the roots.
